purpose: Describe how external systems may integrate with WyneOS in a controlled and predictable manner.

enabled: Monitoring audit logs for operational insight
restricted: Writing directly to any system directories
Executing code inside WyneOS without authorisation

requiredAccess.telemetry: Read-only access to heartbeat, sync, and integrity data.
requiredAccess.registry: Read-only access to registry files for version, health, and capability checks.
requiredAccess.audit: Controlled access to audit logs, if permitted.
requiredAccess.runtime: No direct interaction unless approved through operational policy.

integrationPatterns.monitoring: External systems may track telemetry to assess health and performance.
integrationPatterns.compliance: External systems may reference manifests and seals for audit alignment.
integrationPatterns.governance: External decision tools may evaluate governance outputs but cannot bypass enforcement.

externalRequirements.environment: Stable system environment with access to WyneOS directories.
externalRequirements.security: Independent external security controls must be maintained.
externalRequirements.protocol: Any integration must follow read-only access unless authorised.

riskControls.isolation: WyneOS maintains internal isolation of critical modules.
riskControls.integrityProtection: Seals and manifests ensure tampering is detected immediately.
